clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Education of Medical Team on Duration of Fasting Before Elective Medical Interventions Performed Under General Anesthesia in Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Education of Medical Team on Duration of Fasting Before Elective Medical Interventions Performed Under General Anesthesia in Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to examine if an education program of the medical teams can help implementation of of NPO (nothing-per-os)orders in children before anesthesia for ambulatory medical interventions under anesthesia and decrease unnecessary long fasting. We shall ask parents of such children to fill in a questionnaire regarding pre-anesthesia fasting and regular eating and drinking habits. Thereafter, all medical teams involved with the administration of NPO orders will receive an educational program to explain and implement the NPO orders as are recommended by the American Society of Anesthesiologists. We will examine if the educational program was successful in reducing unnecessary long period of fasting, and if such a program is not associated with increased rate of delay of cases.

clinical_study.why_stopped: unfortunately lacked manpower to carry out the study

primary_outcome.measure: Education of the medical teams as to preoperative fasting time will aid in shortening of an unnecessary prolonged fasting
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate pre-anesthesia period (to assess lenth ofpreoperative fasting time)

intervention.description: The intervention is an education of the medical teams that instruct children to fast before the administration of general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who are about to undergo anesthesia for elective medical interventions,
- Age 0-18 years
